Project Management, Strategic Planning, Execution & Governance 

Serve as a strategic advisor to the Managing Director, aligning operational plans with companywide transformation goals and ensure frontline management.
Lead implementation of cross-functional projects under the Strategic Execution &
Transformation, ensuring milestones, timelines, and deliverables are tracked across all business units.
Establish formal escalation paths for stalled actions and unresolved cross-departmental issues.
Submit weekly and monthly operational summary reports to the MD and provide inputs into board-level strategic updates.
Lead Weekly Operations Review (WOR) HODs meetings and ensure Daily Operations Review
(DOR) cascading meetings are done and minutes recorded, filed and dashboards to track tasks to completion.
Ensure Project Management through Master Plan, Gantt chart and other tools to monitor success.

 Commercial Execution & Accountability 

Chair the Weekly Operations Review (WOR) meetings, ensuring 100% HOD participation and real-time tracker updates as per the Operations Review SOP.
Implement a matrix accountability framework across Factory, Depot, Transport, and

Commercial teams, with clear KPIs and escalation mechanisms.

Assign clear ownership of dashboard reports by department and ensure monthly sign-offs on operations metrics.
Sales Leadership: Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to meet and exceed monthly sales targets
Provide Leadership in marketing and brand management to successfully execute and manage marketing budget, maximize the ROI of all initiatives and maintain high accountability of budget.
Departmental Team Management: Lead, mentor, and motivate a team of Sales Representatives to achieve individual and collective sales goals. Foster a collaborative and results-driven team environment.
Perform Monthly Customer Satisfaction and Net Promoter Score and grow month on month.

Factory Oversight & Maintenance Coordination 

Oversee daily and weekly production planning in line with the Production SOP, coordinating shift schedules, material readiness, and preventive maintenance.
Align production targets with delivery timelines and customer priorities maintain OEE , Lean Six Sigma, Kaizen and DMAIC methodologies to streamline processes.
Define a structured escalation protocol for urgent customer-priority orders and production line downtime decisions in collaboration with the Factory Manager.

Quality, Safety & Legal Compliance 

Ensure 100% adherence to KEBS and ISO quality standards, executing quality protocols and non-conformance reporting as outlined in the Production SOP.
Enforce all health and safety protocols in accordance with the SHE SOP and the company’s Occupational Safety policy.
Oversee compliance with all statutory regulations (KEBS, OSHA, NEMA, KRA) and internal legal frameworks.
Coordinate quarterly SHE audits, maintain PPE compliance logs, and supervise biannual emergency drills.

Budgeting & Cost Control 

Collaborate with Finance to develop and manage operational budgets, monitor variance within ±5%, and escalate deviations as per the Budgeting & Cost Control SOP.

Review monthly cost center performance reports with Finance to guide corrective actions.
Approve expenditure within pre-defined thresholds, escalating capital or exceptional costs as per company policy.
Human Capital, Appraisals & Performance Management 

Lead monthly performance check-ins and quarterly appraisals in line with the HR Manual and the Commission & KPI SOP.
Implement coaching, PIP, and reward/reprimand processes anchored to appraisal outcomes.
PIP cycles shall run for 30–60 days, with HR guidance and documentation per the Disciplinary SOP.
Collaborate with HR to develop a leadership pipeline, succession matrix, and cross-functional training plans.
Implement Train the Trainer Strategy.

ICT Systems Implementation, Utilization & Reporting 

Ensure full adoption and real-time data entry into ERP and CRM platforms, with automated dashboards for operations, dispatch, and production.
Drive reporting, fuel tracking, and customer delivery analytics as per the ERP/CRM Utilization SOP.
Coordinate with ICT for quarterly access review, audit trail monitoring, and system security compliance.
Implement automated operational dashboards and executive reports using Power BI, Tableau,
SQL, and advanced Excel, improving KPI visibility

Depots and Supply Chain Oversight 

Dispatch, Routing & Delivery - Oversee routing plans, fuel calculations, and delivery

sequencing in line with the Routing SOP and Dispatch SOP.

Ensure 100% compliance with OTIF standards, load verification, and sealing protocols

monitored via Loss Control systems.

Escalate failed dispatches, delays, and rerouting issues through the proper chain of command.
Participate in weekly forecast reviews with Commercial and ensure no overdue orders exceed 7 working days.

Loss Control, Fraud Prevention & Risk Management 

Monitor execution of Loss Control Policy and shrinkage prevention strategy across depot, supply chain, commercial and all other areas.
Review CCTV, GPS, fuel sensor logs, and route adherence weekly with the Loss Control Unit.
Ensure all loss or fraud incidents are reported to authorities within 48 hours and

investigations closed within 7 working days.
Environmental Compliance & Sustainability 

Enforce environmental reporting and compliance with internal and NEMA standards as guided by the Environmental Compliance SOP.
Track power usage, machine emissions, and waste management KPIs in collaboration with the HSSE and Maintenance teams.
Support implementation of sustainable practices in production and logistics.

Crisis Management & Business Continuity 

Lead operational response under the Crisis Management Policy, ensuring all incidents are assessed, escalated, and closed with documented resolutions.
Maintain up-to-date risk registers, SOP backups, and continuity plans across key operational areas.
Participate in quarterly simulations and staff briefings on crisis readiness.
Apply the ADR framework to manage formal disputes with closure targeted within 14

working days.

Chemical Management:
Manage the inventory and usage of treatment chemicals such as coagulants, flocculants, and disinfectants.
Optimize chemical dosing to ensure cost-effective operation while maintaining treatment efficiency.
Safety and Environmental Management:
Follow safety protocols during the operation of STP.
Address any spillages or emergencies as per established safety procedures.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Leadership & Staff Management

Supervise and motivate all restaurant staff to maintain high levels of performance and morale.
Assign duties and manage shift schedules to ensure adequate staffing at all times.
Conduct regular team meetings to communicate goals, updates, and feedback.
Mentor and train new staff on company policies, service standards, and operational procedures.
Monitor staff performance and provide coaching or corrective action where needed.

Customer Service Excellence

Ensure every guest receives exceptional service and attention.
Handle customer complaints professionally and resolve issues promptly.
Maintain a welcoming and friendly environment for guests at all times.
Monitor customer feedback to identify areas for improvement and implement changes.

Operational Management

Oversee daily restaurant operations, ensuring smooth workflow across front-of-house and coordination with the kitchen.
Monitor table service, order delivery, and guest satisfaction throughout service hours.
Ensure compliance with health, hygiene, and safety regulations.
Conduct regular inspections to maintain cleanliness, organization, and safety standards.

Financial & Inventory Oversight

Supervise cash handling, POS transactions, and reconciliation at the end of shifts.
Assist in budgeting and cost control, minimizing waste without compromising quality.
Monitor inventory levels of food, beverages, and supplies; coordinate with the kitchen or suppliers for timely restocking.

Performance & Reporting

Track and analyze restaurant performance metrics, including customer satisfaction, sales, and staff efficiency.
Prepare shift or daily reports for management highlighting operational successes or issues.
Implement strategies to improve efficiency, increase sales, and enhance the guest experience.

Multitasking & Problem-Solving

Manage multiple priorities during peak hours, ensuring seamless service.
Quickly resolve operational or service-related challenges while maintaining professionalism.
Make informed decisions under pressure to maintain smooth restaurant operations.

Communication & Coordination

Serve as a liaison between staff, management, and kitchen teams.
Communicate operational updates, promotions, or policy changes effectively to the team.
Collaborate with other departments (e.g., marketing, procurement) to support overall business objectives.

Monitor customer feedback and online engagement to identify areas for improvement.

Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.

KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills

Procurement Planning & Sourcing

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills

Internal Controls and Process Improvement

Ensure proper documentation and adherence to internal control procedures.
Identify process inefficiencies and recommend improvements.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Inventory Management:

Maintain accurate records of all stock items, including receipts, issues, returns, and transfers.
Monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability and prevent overstocking or stockouts.
Classify and organize stock in the warehouse for easy retrieval and minimal losses.

Stock Movement Monitoring:

Track the movement of goods into and out of the warehouse.
Reconcile physical stock with system records regularly and investigate any discrepancies.
Implement FIFO (First In, First Out) or other inventory rotation methods to minimize expiry or obsolescence.

Documentation & Reporting:

Maintain proper documentation for all stock transactions in line with company policies.
Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to management, highlighting stock levels, variances, and trends.
Assist in audits by providing accurate stock records and supporting documentation.

Warehouse Operations:

Ensure the warehouse is clean, organized, and compliant with safety standards.
Supervise warehouse staff in proper stock handling, storage, and packaging.
Coordinate with transport/logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of stock to various locations.

Coordination & Collaboration:

Work closely with the procurement and supply chain teams to forecast inventory needs.
Support the finance team by providing accurate stock valuations and documentation.
Liaise with suppliers and vendors for stock deliveries and resolve any discrepancies.

Process Improvement:

Identify opportunities to improve stock management processes, reduce wastage, and increase efficiency.
Assist in implementing or upgrading stock management software/ERP systems.
Conduct periodic reviews of inventory procedures and recommend improvements.

Team Supervision & Training:

Mentor and supervise junior warehouse staff or assistants.
Provide guidance on best practices for stock handling, storage, and documentation.

Diploma or Degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or a related field.

Proficiency in stock management software, ERP systems, or inventory control tools.
Strong numerical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent organizational and documentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:

Oversee the creation of promotional materials and marketing collateral.

Leadership & Team Management

Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners (agencies, suppliers, distributors).
Champion innovation and creativity within the marketing function.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and convert insights into strategy.
Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Procurement Planning & Sourcing

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills

Assist in audits by providing accurate stock records and supporting documentation.

Liaise with suppliers and vendors for stock deliveries and resolve any discrepancies.

Process Improvement:

Identify opportunities to improve stock management processes, reduce wastage, and increase efficiency.
Assist in implementing or upgrading stock management software/ERP systems.
Conduct periodic reviews of inventory procedures and recommend improvements.

Team Supervision & Training:

Mentor and supervise junior warehouse staff or assistants.
Provide guidance on best practices for stock handling, storage, and documentation.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Inventory Management:

Maintain accurate records of all stock items, including receipts, issues, returns, and transfers.
Monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability and prevent overstocking or stockouts.
Classify and organize stock in the warehouse for easy retrieval and minimal losses.

Stock Movement Monitoring:

Track the movement of goods into and out of the warehouse.
Reconcile physical stock with system records regularly and investigate any discrepancies.
Implement FIFO (First In, First Out) or other inventory rotation methods to minimize expiry or obsolescence.

Documentation & Reporting:

Maintain proper documentation for all stock transactions in line with company policies.
Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to management, highlighting stock levels, variances, and trends.
Assist in audits by providing accurate stock records and supporting documentation.

Warehouse Operations:

Supervise warehouse staff in proper stock handling, storage, and packaging.
Coordinate with transport/logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of stock to various locations.

Coordination & Collaboration:

Work closely with the procurement and supply chain teams to forecast inventory needs.
Support the finance team by providing accurate stock valuations and documentation.
Liaise with suppliers and vendors for stock deliveries and resolve any discrepancies.

Process Improvement:

Identify opportunities to improve stock management processes, reduce wastage, and increase efficiency.
Assist in implementing or upgrading stock management software/ERP systems.
Conduct periodic reviews of inventory procedures and recommend improvements.

Team Supervision & Training:

Mentor and supervise junior warehouse staff or assistants.
Provide guidance on best practices for stock handling, storage, and documentation.
